As others, I will also go with "Target Resources" and "Session"

The Session section is used for configuring Global Secure Access security profiles because it allows you to enforce specific session controls, such as requiring multifactor authentication (MFA) or device compliance, for traffic routed through Global Secure Access. This is essential for managing ongoing access and security during the session.

The Grant option, on the other hand, is typically used to enforce immediate access requirements, such as requiring MFA or device compliance at the point of login12. While it can be used to set conditions for granting access, it doesn't provide the same level of control over the session as the Session section does.
